name: Gló - Iceland's Pioneer Organic & Healthy Restaurant
description: Gló has pioneered healthy eating in Iceland since opening in 2007, fundamentally changing how Icelanders view nutritious food by proving that organic, vegetarian, vegan, and raw preparations can deliver flavor, satisfaction, and culinary creativity equal to conventional restaurant fare—this transformation reflects broader shift in Iceland where traditional diet centered almost exclusively on fish, lamb, and dairy has gradually expanded to embrace plant-based eating, international flavors, and health-conscious dining that previous generations might have dismissed as unnecessary or incompatible with Icelandic food culture. Operating three locations across Reykjavík with the downtown location offering 100% vegan menu while other sites provide both plant-based and meat options, Gló demonstrates flexibility and inclusivity that allows diners with diverse dietary preferences or restrictions to find satisfying meals whether eating purely plant-based, incorporating some animal products, following raw food principles, or managing food allergies and sensitivities. The menu changes daily based on seasonal availability and kitchen creativity.
